intro: Monopsis litigiosa, commonly known as the warbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along stream banks. Monopsis litigiosa is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
